question.questionText: Ms. Larson's class found the best condition to hatch brine-shrimp eggs: 2 spoons of salt in 200 milliliters of water. The class decided to hatch more eggs. Ms. Larson mixed a new solution using 2 spoons of salt in 200 milliliters of water. Later, she discovered she had used a slightly different size spoon to measure the salt. Even with this different solution, some eggs still hatched. Why did some eggs still hatch?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The different salt solution is within the range of tolerance for brine shrimp eggs to hatch.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Because some eggs can handle more salt but some eggs cannot handle more salt.
